data.title: Great food
data.text: Great Greek food and friendly servers.  Good prices. Sit outside and enjoy watching the people at the fountain.

data.title: Very Good!  Worth its high marks.
data.text: Food was very tasty - a gyro for me and an eggplant dish for my wife.  Both were very good and pricing was reasonable.  On a September evening, can sit outside on the sidewalk, which was especially enjoyable.  Dishes were solid, if not exotic - very good.

data.title: Great menu!
data.text: The menu was really well done! The lamb  entree was excellent and the baklava was excellent! They had a nice selection of beers on tap including a couple local brews.

data.title: Excellent food and location!
data.text: We sat outside near the fountain with a beautiful view.  All the food was fantastic, the service very friendly.  We invited a few friends to join us to continue the meal.  Couldn't ask for more!

data.title: Always great food and service!
data.text: The wait staff is always so nice.  The have great salads that can be adjusted for picky people.  The grilled shrimp salad is delicious.  Gyros and souvlaki are always yummy as well and you can get them as a salad if you want to.  I really like the small wine list and love the Greek wine...sorry, I forget the name but it's like the 3rd white one on the menu.  I just found out they do fresh fish on the weekends.  I usually go for lunch during the week but I will definitely give that a shot.  I hear they make fresh calamari steak which is hard to find.  Such nice people work there and they make you feel really welcome.  I've gone on my birthday and they gave me a free ouzo shot/drink and  baklava.  So nice!

data.title: Never Disappointed!
data.text: I am a big fan of this place. We go often and I have never left dissatisfied. Food is always fresh and delicious. Service is super friendly and prompt. Great atmosphere, even for my kiddos ages 2 & 4. Great kids meals that even come with a small ice cream for dessert!  Their pick up is even great. This place is a gem and I hope it never changes!

data.title: Lively, well-run, Greek hybrid
data.text:
Spouse and I sneaked in without a reservation Saturday evening just before the dinner rush. 

Indoors is happily noisy with couples, groups, and families. Outdoor seating is pleasant but a little cramped just outside the front door.

Upside of the menu: They seem to have something for everyone, most ages (kids, but not tinies), adventurous and not-so-much. Prices are a good value.

Parts of the menu are genuinely Greek (with the usual Turkish influence): mousaka, gyros, dolmathes (stuffed grape leaves), louganiko sausage, skordalia, tzatziki, saganaki, horiatiki (“Greek Village Salad” on the menu), souvlaki.

Some dishes are adapted to the California mainstream (Mediterranean and Mexican), adding gyro meat, Greek olives, or feta to salads, pasta, and burgers for example, or topping entrees with “house Mediterranean salsa” of tomato, onion, and sweet bell pepper.

And some dishes are completely fresh-American mainstream, like chicken or tri-tip sandwiches, fries, and green salad.

My chicken reganati was a perfectly tender, tasty chicken breast, marinated and charbroiled, then topped with that “mediterranean salsa” and crumbled feta. The scoop of rice pilaf was flavorful but mushy. Side veggies of zucchini, onions, and green beans were perfectly cooked and seasoned, then combined for a variety of textures. Spouse’s swordfish brochette/souvlaki was the same dish with a different protein and form factor.

High marks:
   - Basket of sliced, grilled bread before the entrees served with soft, composed garlic butter. I *loved* it! Spouse was less enthusiastic; woman at the next table seemed alarmed
   - Really good feta — flavorful and moist, not just US mass-market
   - Full bar, including ouzo and Greek brandy, plus Greek choices on the small wine list
   - Cheerful, well-organized service, from entry to kitchen to table to check to exit

Biggest conflict: Fresh galaktoboureko (yay!) with still-crispy top and delicious syrup had a filling that was more like sweet scrambled egg than custard. Too bad their otherwise great quality control didn't extend to dessert. Our waiter admitted it’s different every time.

data.title: Lunch
data.text:
I visit often and have yet to be disappointed.   Not only is the food top notch, but the service is exceptional & very professional. 
Great place for lunch or dinner.

data.title: Lively Atmosphere and Great Food
data.text: Whether a small meal or larger, one can always depend on tasty eats.  Maybe, a visit by the owner Demitri at your table. Great for lunch or dinner.  Hoopah!!!  Enjoy. 😊

data.title: Lunch in Livermore
data.text: Demitri's is a nice restaurant. Nice atmosphere and good food.  I had the tri-tip Ceaser salad it was a meal size salad and tri-tip was very good. My friends spaghetti was just ok but bread and garlic spread was very good. All in all a nice lunch

data.title: Downtown Greek treat
data.text: Demitri's is a great casual restaurant in downtown Livermore. They have a great selection of Greek specialties. My favorite is the traditional beef and lamb Gyro. Everything I have eaten there has been flavorful and reasonably priced.

data.title: Best Gyros anywhere!
data.text: These are some of the best gyros.  I love Zorbas but Dimitri's is hands down, the second best or maybe neck in neck.

data.title: Excellent Greek foid
data.text: I enjoyed the Traditional ground lamb/beef dish I ordered. My friends had the shrimp special. We even ordered Greek St George's grape wine. Service was excellent!

data.title: Good service, outdoor seating
data.text: Had a good meal, great wine list. Service was prompt, food fresh. Loved sitting outside near fountain.

data.title: Great local Greek Food
data.text: Being a local to the Livermore area, Demitri's is a fun place to eat.  The food is good and the servers lover what they do.  Oh-pa!!!

data.title: Amazing food, lovely staff, great night
data.text: A very relaxed little  on the up coming Abbeydale Road close to the picture palace. A friendly welcome, extensive authentic Greek menu. Food excelled all expectation. Starters were great and the sharing grill was so extensive that it could feed a family of 4!! Fantastic tastes, a little piece of Greece in Sheffield

data.title: Fun & Friendly
data.text: Can't beat their Moussaka & everything else I have tried is really good, tender lemony calamari and amazing lamb chops. All served with a smile. Try their street side dining for a spring lunch or a summer dinner. Love the atmosphere in & out of this restaurant.

data.title: Got Greek?
data.text: Yummy traditional Greek food that you can't beat. Celebrate special occasions - or just getting out of the house - with a shot of ouzo to perk up the taste buds!

data.title: A great resturant for Mediterian food always busy & service is perfect all the time of the day & night
data.text: I would recommend anything on the menu you can't go wrong with any choice so go for it & you can eat outside as well

data.title: greek food
data.text:
The best greek foodbin the livermore valley, the waitress and waiters are so awesome. Love the greek spread with the warm bread melts in your mouth. The desserts are so good.the cream of wheat dessert with the  warm sauce thats poured on top. The meatballs with spagetti is good and their specials are good a pasta dish and their lamb sandwiches too. Demetri makes you feel so good
opa!!!!
